name: St. Æthelwold of Winchester
summary: Æthelwold was Bishop of Winchester and a key figure in the 10th-century English monastic reform movement. Along with St. Dunstan and St. Oswald, he worked to restore Benedictine monasticism in England after the Viking invasions. He founded or reformed many monasteries, including Abingdon Abbey, and was known for his strict adherence to the Rule of St. Benedict. He translated the Rule of St. Benedict into Old English and was a patron of learning and the arts.
